newsitem.title: UK: UK wool sale sees good competition and clearance.
newsitem.headline: UK wool sale sees good competition and clearance.

text.p: Very good competition throughout the sale resulted in a clearance rate of more than 95 percent, with forward sales being completed at a premium, sources said.
Crosses were fully firm, cheviots and halfbreds in sellers favour, while blackface were fully firm to sellers favour apart from blackface cotts which were 2.5 percent cheaper.
A large offering of Northern Ireland sold well.
The Committee of London Wool Brokers acting on behalf the British Wool Marketing Board, offered approximately 2,457,312 million kilos of British wool.
